pack.tcc.hover_event: Click here to go to the official website
item.tcc.enchanted_golden_apple_pie_slic: Slice of Enchanted Golden Apple Pie
item.tcc.easter_egg.lore: insert witty easter egg text here
item.tcc.diluted_potion.effect.turtle_ma: Diluted Potion of the Turtle Master
commands.tcc.trigger.spectator: This command cannot be used in spectator mode. Try again in another gamemode.
commands.tcc.wrong_version: You are usin: You are using TCC on the incorrect Minecraft version. Please check the download.
commands.tcc.give_all_recipes_error: It: It seems that you have a mod/datapack installed that gives the player all recipes. Please disable it or performance may be drastically lowered. You can safely ignore this message if you are not worried about performance.
chat.tcc.gamerules.title: TCC Gamerules
chat.tcc.gamerules.tea_timer.description: Toggle always displaying the timer of a tea effect
chat.tcc.gamerules.charged_discs.descrip: Toggle charged discs changing the weather
chat.tcc.gamerules.gobblerift_meat_nbt.d: Toggle the gobblerift eating meat that has custom NBT in it
chat.tcc.gamerules.reduced_golden_chorus: Toggle golden chorus fruit spreading players in a smaller radius to prevent server lag
death.attack.tcc.boomerang: %s didn't realize that boomerangs come back
death.attack.tcc.swordfish: %1$s impaled themselves from the inside out
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.wan: Make a trade with a wandering witch using some spider eyes
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.ent: Follow a tundra explorer map from a cartographer into a chilly illager fort in the mountains
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.kil: Find and kill a geomancer deep underground
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.obt: Take a frostbloom from the depths of a tundra keep
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.fre: Feed a parrot frostbloom petals... Birds of a feather, freeze together.
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.obt: Obtain a useful enchanting tool from the hidden basement of a woodland mansion and use it to store experience
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.ent: Dive down into the depths of an ocean monument
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.sou: Use a pair of soul conductors connected with sculk to travel 1000 blocks instantly
advancements.tcc.minecraft.adventure.use: Use a charged music disc to change the weather
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.eat_golde: Coat a chorus fruit in gold and take a bite. Who knows where you could end up!
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.feed_gobb: Find a unique plant from a special section of an end city, grow it to full size, and feed it some meat
advancements.tcc.minecraft.end.drink_rif: Drink some riftjuice from a gobblerift using a glass bottle after feeding it plenty of meat and waiting for it to digest
advancements.tcc.minecraft.husbandry.eat: Eat the last piece of a pie
advancements.tcc.minecraft.husbandry.buc: Kidnap a snail from their swampy natural habitat using a bucket
Bucket all six types of snail
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.cursed: Wear a strange crown received from the depths of the nether
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.teapot: Take some brewed tea from a teapot using a glass bottle
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.smolde: Use a smoldering seeker in the nether to get the location of a fortress
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.use_po: Use an ender pearl on a positional anchor to be activated later with redstone
advancements.tcc.minecraft.nether.molten: Use a molten mirror to flip a potion effect on yourself into its reversed equivalent
subtitles.tcc.block.soul_conductor.trans: Soul Conductor fails to transport player
item.tcc.compendium.index_page.title: Index Page (%s/%s)
item.tcc.compendium.faq_page.title: Helpful Hints
item.tcc.compendium.faq_page.text:
- Use /function tcc:commands/<press tab> for all commands. 
- %s can be run to open a gamerule menu.

 - Use /loot give @s loot tcc:items/<press tab> to get items from the pack.
item.tcc.compendium.cover_page.content:
A comprehensive guide to all the content in The Creeper's Code.

To get another copy, run %s
item.tcc.compendium.entry.example.page_0:
This is an example.

Pages like this explain features in detail, and may have images or recipes.

You can click the icon at the top to run a related command and also click icons in recipes to get items.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.absorption_imp: The absorption effect is now removed if lose all your absorption hearts by taking damage.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.armor_stand_wi: You can now put arms onto armor stands by adding sticks to them in a crafting table. You can also pose said armor stands by right-clicking them with a %s to give them some cool poses.
Some of the poses you can give the armor stands. This is only three out of many different poses!
The above recipe is shapeless, meaning it can be made from any variation of an armor stand and two sticks.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.apple_pie.page: Apple pie is a unique food item that can be eaten three times, as it has three slices. Three apples for three slices! Don't eat the last slice of your friend's pie though, they'll get mad. There's also a %s.
The above recipe is shapeless, meaning it can be put anywhere in the crafting space.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.axolotl_bucket: Axolotl buckets now have proper variants, so you can see what type of axolotl you have in your bucket. This also works with baby axolotls, which are insanely cute.
LOOK AT THEM. CUTENESS OVERLOAD. TOO CUTE. CANNOT... WRITE... DESCRIPTION...
item.tcc.compendium.entry.banner_pattern: Banner patterns can now be duplicated by placing a banner pattern with a piece of paper in the crafting table, similarly to how maps are duplicated via cartography table. Make copies of your rare patterns for your friends!
The above recipe is shapeless and works with any banner pattern.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.bat_wing.page_: Bat wings are dropped by bats in amounts of 1-2, and can be crafted into leather. Helpful for early-game leather! They can also be crafted into %s as well.
Just like the rabbit hide recipe, in a 2x2 square.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.better_recipes: Many recipes have been improved. Stairs and trapdoors now have an output of 6, prismarine recipes have been improved, many stone items can be crafted with blackstone or deepslate, and the WHITE tulip crafts into WHITE dye, not gray.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.biome_based_fi: The rarities of fish now depend on the biome you're in. Salmon are four times as common in rivers, tropical fish and pufferfish are twice as common in warm oceans, and %s are twice as common in frozen oceans.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.blind_rage_pot: The blind rage potion is made by brewing a %s into an awkward potion. It gives Strength III and Blindness for 15s, which can be extended to 30s with redstone. It cannot be amplified with glowstone, it but can be %s with %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.boomerang.page: The boomerang is a fun weapon that bounces off walls, hits multiple enemies, and comes back to you! It also breaks any crops it flies through, making it a great farming tool too. It has 300 durability and accepts unbreaking, mending, and vanishing.
The planks in this recipe can be of any wood, not just oak.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cake_improveme: Cake can now be easily broken and picked up again, without destroying the cake in the process. It also has different textures depending on the number of slices.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.campfire_impro: Campfires will now drop unlit campfires when broken with an axe without silk touch. When broken with silk touch, they drop a lit campfire. When broken without an axe or silk touch, they drop coal.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.charged_music_: Charged music discs are obtained from charged creepers killed by skeletons (or %s). They make the weather thunder when put into a jukebox. The thunder lasts as long as the song lasts, making "blocks" the best song at 5:45.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.climbable_chai: Chains can now be climbed like ladders. Very simple feature, but fun for builds and stuff.
Coral fans and normal coral can be crafted into coral blocks. This also applies to dead coral. An example recipe is given on the next page, and all the others are in the default recipe book.

This makes coral completely renewable!
This recipe can be used in the small crafting menu as well, as it is only 2x2.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.cursed_crown.p: The cursed crown can be found in bastion loot. It changes all non-gold items dropped by mobs to gold and comes with curse of binding. Yikes. It accepts helmet enchantments and has 200 durability that decreases on kill or when you're hurt.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.diluted_potion: Diluted potions are a new potion type, created by brewing %s into a normal potion. Diluting a potion divides its duration into ten 'sips'. For example, diluting a 60 second speed potion gives you a 6 second diluted potion with ten uses.
An example of brewing some diluted potions.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.drowned_varian: Drowned can spawn covered in coral and sponge. Sponge drowned only spawn in ocean monuments. Drowned variants drop the material they're covered in, making these resources renewable and easier to access early-game.
They blend right into the coral reefs! Except the sponge variant, he sticks out like a sore thumb.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.dyed_bundles.p: Bundles can now be dyed with every type of dye by adding the dye to the middle of the recipe. Great for sorting! Additionally, the bundle recipe has also been re-added. You cannot re-dye a bundle or dye an existing bundle.
This recipe accepts any color dye.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.fungal_stew.pa: You can now make a stew from a variety of nether plants mixed together. When eaten, it gives fire resistance for 15 seconds. Useful for surviving short encounters with lava... or surviving in the nether without any other food sources.
The above recipe is shapeless, and can be placed anywhere in the crafting menu.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.glow_lichen_zo: The glow lichen zombie spawns rarely in the deepslate layer of the world. It gives the blindness effect on hit, and drops glow lichen and the %s. It spawns more commonly in lush caves as well.
What a spooky mob... just look at those black eyes. A terror of the deep caves for sure.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.echo_shard_ren: When a sculk shrieker that can summon a warden is triggered, any amethyst clusters hit by its shriek particles will be broken and drop an echo shard. Very useful for %s, %s, and %s, but also dangerous!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.elder_guardian: Elder guardians now clear any mining fatigue you have when you kill them. They also give the effect constantly while you're inside the monument to prevent cheesing. They also drop 1-2 nautilus shells instead of a single wet sponge.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.emoji.title: Emoji
item.tcc.compendium.entry.emoji.page_0.d: If you type "/trigger tcc.emoji" in chat, a menu will come up with many various emoji you can click to print out. Each emoji has its own number as well. For example, running "/trigger tcc.emoji set 3" makes an angry emoji. Express yourself!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.enchanted_gold: Enchanted golden carrots give you night vision for five minutes. They give the same amount of hunger as a normal golden carrot.
Same recipe as normal golden carrots, but with gold ingots instead of gold nuggets.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.enchanter.page: The enchanter is a powerful "support" illager that helps illagers and hostile mobs with magic buffs. They are the main inhabitants of the %s, and they rarely drop %s. They also spawn in raids.
Enchanters care more about reading than you. They're entirely harmless aside from their support buffs.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.end_crystal_he: End crystals will now heal players wearing dragon heads with a regeneration effect for ten seconds. Guess they aren't smart enough to tell you apart from the actual dragon.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.fortitude_poti: Fortitude potions give health boost for 3 minutes, and are brewed from %s. They can be extended to 8 minutes, or amplified to give health boost II for 1.5 minutes. They can also be %s using %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frost_walker_i: Frost walker has undergone many tweaks. First off, when riding a horse and wearing frost walker boots, the horse will also leave a trail of ice. Additionally, you'll move faster when you walk on packed, normal and blue ice with frost walker.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom.pag: The frostbloom is a potent magical flower, found in the %s. It freezes blocks, makes snow around it, damages blazes, magma cubes and striders, and heals snow golems. It also drops %s when bone-mealed.
The room in the %s that the frostbloom is found in.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.frostbloom_pet: When eaten, these petals give regeneration II for 8 seconds, as well as slowness II and an icy screen overlay for 30 seconds. Very powerful healing, but at the cost of your visibility and mobility.
Frostbloom petals drop from %s when bone-mealed, and are dropped by strays 5%% of the time and by %s 50%% of the time. They can be made into a %s too.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_apple_p: Golden apple pie is the gold variant of %s. It can be eaten 3 times to get golden apple effects. The effects last 33%% longer, meaning you get the duration of 4 golden apples for the price of 3! There is also an enchanted golden apple variant.
The above recipe is shapeless, meaning it can be put anywhere in the crafting space.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.golden_chorus_: Golden chorus fruit is the golden variant of chorus fruit. Rather than teleporting you a short distance, it teleports you very far. The maximum distance is around 2000 blocks. Great for a quick getaway!
Similar to a golden apple—just cover the thing in gold ingots!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.heartbeet.page: Heartbeets are a rare food dropped by fully grown beetroot plants 5%% of the time. They give 30 seconds of health boost when eaten, and fill as much hunger as a golden carrot. They can also be brewed into %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.iceologer.page: The iceologer is a dangerous illager wizard that summons massive blocks of falling ice, and freezes you directly if you retreat under cover. They also drop %s, and spawn in the %s and raids in snowy biomes.
Just look at that icy stare! Brrr...
Amethyst dust is a potion ingredient used to create %s. It is dropped by %s, rarely traded by the %s, and drops 2.5%% of the time from fully grown amethyst buds.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.geomancer.page: Geomancers are very strange and terrifying illagers that only spawn in the deepslate layer of the caves. They summon magical pillars to trap and explode you, which can be quite a dangerous combo.
They drop amethyst shards and %s. They also drop 5-7 raw iron, gold, or copper.
Look at those tattered clothes and ratty beard... he's been down in the caves a while.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.jungle_temple_: Jungle temple dispensers now have poison arrows, rather than normal arrows. Incredibly simple!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.more_suspiciou: You can now make suspicious stew from chorus flowers to give yourself 10 seconds of levitation, or with flowering azaleas to give yourself 20 seconds of water breathing.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.locket_of_lear:
The locket is a helpful enchanting tool. On right-click, it stores experience points, and when shift-right-
clicked, it gives you points back. It is dropped by %s, and can be found in %s.
Various levels of filled lockets. At max fill, a locket stores enough xp to take you from 0 to 30 levels.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.loot_table_imp: Some small changes have been made to loot tables. Zombies drop iron nuggets, zombie villagers drop emeralds instead of iron ingots, spiders drop cobwebs rarely, and shulkers drop 1-2 shells, instead of 0-1.
The nausea potion is made by brewing %s into an awkward potion. It gives 30s of Nausea, which can be extended to 60s with redstone. It cannot be amplified with glowstone, but it can be %s with %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.nether_reactor: The nether reactor gives friendly mobs (players, tamed mobs, villagers, etc.) fire resistance, gives striders Speed III, and clears Wither I in a 64 block radius. It is activated using a complex structure shown on the next page.
In order to form a full reactor, you make the above multiblock structure, building from layer 1 upwards.
It is made using lots of valuables, including a nether star... good luck!
The molten mirror is a magic device that flips effects. It takes damage per effect flipped based on the amplifier of the effect. It can only flip to a maximum amplifier of II. For example, luck IV flips to bad luck II, rather than bad luck IV.

Here is the full list of which effects flip into which, each labeled with either a one-way sign (→) or a two-way sign (↔), indicating whether the flip goes both ways.

Speed↔Slowness

Regeneration↔Poison

Strength↔Weakness

Haste↔Mining Fatigue

Night Vision↔Blindness

Invisibility↔Glowing

Slow Falling↔Levitation

Water Breathing↔Fire Resistance

Luck↔Bad Luck

Jump Boost→Slowness

Nausea→Night Vision

Dolphin's Grace→Slowness

Hunger→Saturation

Health Boost→Poison

Absorption→Poison

Resistance→Wither

Wither→Regeneration

That's a lot of flips... Here's an example. Jump boost flips to slowness, which flips to speed, which flips back into slowness.
That's quite a lot of blaze rods... are you sure you want to make this thing?
item.tcc.compendium.entry.more_mineable_: More blocks now have proper tools. Glass-like blocks, levers, frosted ice, and heads can now be mined faster with pickaxes. Cactus, honeycomb, cakes, melons, pumpkins, and froglights can be mined faster with hoes.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.more_mossy_rec: Mossy cobblestone and mossy stone brick blocks (stairs, walls, and slabs) can now be crafted with a single moss block or vine combined with the non-mossy block you wish to mossify. No more wasting resources if you just want one mossy block!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.more_stonecutt: Stone and deepslate can be cut into cobblestone and cobbled deepslate to make building easier when working with silk touch. Also, prismarine can be cut into prismarine bricks.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.ocean_monument: The ocean monument has been completely reworked to include better loot, a better build, and a completely randomized interior maze. You also get much better loot: a trident, 24 gold blocks, and 32 sponge.
The outside is quite a bit more detailed than the original, as you can see in this image.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.paintbrush.pag: The paintbrush is a tool used to paint blocks with dye. It can be used on concrete, shulker boxes, etc. It can also cycle paintings' art and paint shulkers. It prioritizes dyes in your offhand, and also can be used from the offhand.
Nice and cheap for a handy tool!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.phantom_item_f: The phantom item frame is an amazing tool for decoration, and another use for phantom membranes. When you place an item in it, the frame surrounding it will turn invisible, leaving only the item.
The different stages of placing an item in the phantom item frame, from left to right.
Just like the normal item frame recipe, but with phantom membrane instead of leather.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.pig_improvemen: In order to make pigs a better mob and allow them to keep up with other livestock, they will now have 2-3 babies when breeding rather than just one. The chance for 3 babies at once is 50%.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.accessible_mus: Creepers killed by piglins now drop a pigstep disc. Creepers killed by shulkers now drop an otherside disc. Creepers killed by wardens now drop "5" music disc shards. Jam out to tunes even if you don't have any structures nearby!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.positional_anc: The positional anchor is a useful technical block. When you insert an ender pearl inside it and power it, it will fire said ender pearl, teleporting you. It's very efficient for multiplayer or short-distance transport.
It requires valuable crying obsidian, similarly to the other "anchor" block, the respawn anchor.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.recovery_compa: The recovery compass has been fully reworked. When you die, the items you drop will glow blue and never despawn. Additionally, the recovery compass with stay with you when you respawn.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.rotten_porkcho: This food item drops from zombified piglins and zoglins, and replaces their rotten flesh drop. Make sure you cook it before eating, otherwise it gives nausea for 30 seconds. It also angers zombie piglins... they don't like it when you eat their friends.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.sculk_recipe.p: Sculk can now be crafted from four sculk vein in a square shape. This recipe was added when I realized how much sculk was needed for %s and how useless sculk veins were.
This recipe is only 2x2, so it can be made in your inventory as well for convenience.
The sightless eye is an rare ingredient, dropped from %s about 10%% of the time. It can be brewed into %s, and can also be used to make a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.silk_touch_imp: Silk touch now picks up farmland, grass paths, filled composters, infested blocks, charged respawn anchors, and note blocks. Bee nests and hives will also show if they have honey in the inventory as well.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.smoldering_see: Smoldering seekers are special compasses crafted with nether bricks that point to nether fortresses when clicked in the nether. No more searching for eons! They can also be bound to lodestones and found in ruined portal loot.
A simple recipe... the real challenge is following the compass through the treacherous nether.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.snail.page_0.d: Snails are an adorable, portable slime farm that can be bucketed. When fed beetroot, they create %s for 20 minutes. There are five variants of snails that naturally spawn, and one egg-only secret variant. Maybe do some soul-searching...
item.tcc.compendium.entry.snail.page_1.d: You can also breed two snails together using beetroot soup. Then, wait for the pregnant snail to lay its eggs into a clay block beneath it. Then after about 30 minutes, more snails hatch from the block along with lots of clay and %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.snail.page_2.d: Groups of snails naturally spawn in swamps. They can't handle saltwater, so the swamp is perfect!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.snail_mucus.pa: Snail mucus is the main product of the %s, and is created after feeding it beetroot. It can be used to lengthen the effects of %s, and also can be used as slime in recipes.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.soul_conductor: The soul conductor is a powerful transport block. Attaching two conductors with sculk and clicking one will transport you to the other. There are also complex mechanics involving more than two conductors, which are described in %s.
An example of two soul conductors connected. Clicking one teleports you to the other.
It's crafted using two echo shards, making it a powerful, unique reward for the deep dark.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.soul_seer.page: The soul seer is a useful magical block. When right-clicked with glowstone dust, it consumes the dust and makes all entities in a 24 block radius glow for 10 seconds. Useful for finding those annoying monsters hiding in your walls!
It's crafted with sculk, making it a useful reward for looting the deep dark.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.sweet_berry_mu: Sweet berry muffins are a tasty food item. They're also superior to eating plain sweet berries, since you can't accidentally plant them.
The above recipe is shapeless, and can also be made in the 2x2 crafting menu. Muffins on the go!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.glow_berry_muf: Glow berry muffins are a tasty food item. They're also superior to eating plain glow berries, since you can't accidentally plant them.
The above recipe is shapeless, and can also be made in the 2x2 crafting menu. Muffins on the go!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.swordfish.page: The swordfish is a food... or is it a weapon? Who knows! It can be fished up about 1%% of the time, or 2%% when you're in a frozen ocean biome due to %s. Drowned also spawn with them 5%% of the time.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tangling_pearl: The tangling pearl is a simple item made from twisting vines and an ender pearl. When right-clicked, it turns on and will teleport nearby items to you when in your inventory. It does not teleport items you drop. Right-click again to turn it off.
The above recipe is shapeless and can be placed anywhere in the crafting menu.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.title: Tea
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.page_0.des: Tea is a remedy to negative potion effects. It is made using a teapot, %s, and an ingredient. It gives a 5-minute immunity to a specific negative effect, depending on the ingredient used. The next pages explain this process.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.page_1.des:
To make a specific tea:
1. Add water bottle
2. Add %s
3. Add your ingredient
4. Add %s to extend duration of tea to 7:30 (optional)
5. Take out your tea with a glass bottle

The next pages list ingredients/immunities.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.page_2.des:
Wither Rose: Wither

Dandelion: Nausea

Sea Pickle: Blindness

Ink Sac: Glowing

Rabbit's Foot: Bad Luck

Honey Bottle: Poison
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.page_3.des:
Sweet Berries: Hunger

Wet Sponge: Mining Fatigue

%s: Weakness

%s: Slowness

%s: Levitation
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.page_4.des:
Echo Shard: Darkness Immunity

Darkness immunity tea works especially well with the %s mechanic.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tea.page_5.des: The teapot must be placed on a lit campfire to make tea inside it.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.totem_improvem: Totems of Undying will now give you water breathing if you died in water, and also levitation and slow falling if you fall in the void.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.trident_repair: Tridents can now be repaired by surrounding a trident with eight prismarine crystals. This also removes all enchantments on the trident as well, so be careful.
This recipe will repair the trident fully, no matter how damaged it may be.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.tundra_keep.pa: This snowy illager fort is surrounded by %s and pillagers. The inside has loot chests and a %s. Cartographers trade a map to either this structure or the %s for 20-30 emeralds.
Quite a big structure, with a lot of loot... and a lot of enemies.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.village_mangro: Villages now spawn in the mangrove swamp, with paths intertwined between mangrove roots, unique mangrove buildings, and %s pens. Cartographers trade a map to either this structure or the %s for 20-30 emeralds.
It even spawns the unused swamp villager variant!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.wandering_trad:
Wandering traders have now been completely reworked. They now have seven new trades.

1. One emerald for one seed (potato, carrot, pumpkin seed, melon seed, beetroot seed, and sweet berries)

2. One emerald for one sapling of any type (Oak, birch, dark oak, acacia, jungle, mangrove, spruce)

3. Two emeralds for cave items (Spore blossoms, moss, small dripleaf, pointed dripstone, glow berries, rooted dirt)

4. Two emeralds for desert items (Red sand, sand, cactus, dead bushes)

5. Three emeralds for jungle items (Lily pads, vines, bamboo, cocoa beans)

6. Four emeralds for ocean items (Coral plants, sea pickles, kelp, nautilus shells)

7. Five emeralds for a bucketed mob (%s, axolotl, pufferfish, cod, salmon, tropical fish, tadpole)

Trader llamas also now spawn with chests containing some food and emeralds so you can buy things from the trader even if you don't have emeralds, and so you get a food reward from the trader even if you don't want to buy anything.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.warped_wart.pa: A key ingredient in making %s and %s. There's also a warped wart block recipe added, requiring 2 nether wart and 2 warped roots, which doesn't quite deserve its own entry.
This recipe is shapeless and can be placed anywhere in the crafting menu.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.weeping_eye.pa: This handy tool locates end cities. When right-clicked in the end, its eye opens up and stares in the direction of the nearest end city. A bit creepy, but it does its job well. It can also be rebound to lodestones if you want a weird compass.
The above recipe is shapeless, and can be placed anywhere in the crafting menu.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.witch_hat.page: The witch hat is a cosmetic item that gives +3 armor and has 100 durability. It's traded by the %s and dropped by witches about 7.5%% of the time. (100%% when the witch is killed by a charged creeper.) It accepts helmet enchantments.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.wandering_witc: The wandering witch is a new type of trader that spawns at night and sells rare items like the %s or an ancient city map for spider eyes. Additionally, she spawns with her trusty llama steed with a chest of goodies.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.woodland_mansi: The woodland mansion has been completely reworked, to include lots of new rooms, better loot, and %s. The main reward for the mansion, the %s, is located in the hidden basement section. Keep an eye out for hidden rooms!
Hidden rooms have hints such as red candles, cracked walls, and even special wall patterns...
The wrench is a useful tool used to rotate lots of blocks. Chests, pillars, logs, etc. It can even force open iron trapdoors! It has 200 durability and accepts unbreaking, mending, and curse of vanishing.
Yay, more things to make with copper!
item.tcc.compendium.entry.gobblerift.pag: The gobblerift is a very unique carnivorous plant found within %s in a growable seedling form. You can grow it from this seedling stage using lots of bonemeal. After growing to full size, it becomes hungry.

This hunger can only be satisfied by feeding it  about 64 pieces of meat. After feeding, it digests for several minutes and forms %s you can harvest with a glass bottle. This mechanic is explained on its own page, linked above.
The various stages of gobblerift growth, including the filled stage at the end.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.riftjuice_bott: Riftjuice is a special liquid harvested from %s. When drank, it teleports you back to the location of the gobblerift you took it from. This works even if you break and move the gobblerift to a new location. It can also be made into a %s.
item.tcc.compendium.entry.end_city_addit: End city additions are special sub-sections of the end city that spawn rarely off of normal end cities. They are filled with lots of loot, including their major treasure, the %s. However, watch out for the multitudes of shulkers.
An example of an end city addition, in this case an addition containing a %s.
